review_title: Stay away until some things are fixed.
job_title: Pharmacy Technician II in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Occassional employment recognition and occasional free food. Good coworkers
cons: Worked at this hospital for a little over a year with 15 years experience in the industry. Management is rife with favoritism and screws its employees on paying out any PTO they have banked after providing your notice. HR has played a role in this as well further cementing that they won't pay out the PTO I had banked. When I tried to take time off I was met with "we really need your help" lines. Management engages in egregious disciplinary practices going as far as writing up its employees for being sick even after providing doctor's notes from within their own system. FYI for Union, its against the law to terminate someone's employment for being sick. (Not applicable in my case however Management engaged in activities that would have ultimately led to this in my case as I felt singled out. Offered to work additional hours and was met with resistance, receiving feedback that it was not within the budget while other more tenured staff got more hours. Overall, do not recommend and if I have an option to go to another hospital for care such as regional, I most assurdly will.

review_title: Effective leadership, strong culture, and patient centric

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Great group of co-workers and physicians, pay was fairly competitive for me but this is not always the case.
cons: Short staffed, always pushed to cram more patients in which is disrespectful of the patient when there's a 2 hour or more wait on a regular basis. Upper management makes decisions with no regard for the clinical staff who end up bearing the brunt of their poor decisions (such as undergoing an EMR change in November during the busiest time of the year without having the appropriate IT in place). The last straw has been mandating every employee (regardless of whether you work in the hospital or clinic office) to pick up an additional two full (8 or 12hr) shifts per pay period in either the hospital or convenient care with no allowances for childcare needs, school, physical limitations or comfort zone. It's a shame that a health care organization would show such utter disregard for their employees wellbeing.

job_title: Nurse in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Coworkers are family.  Pay is decent.
cons: They are so short staffed if you are a bedside nurse, they will not allow you to go into management even if you are qualified.  Raises, health insurance, and company benefits are a joke.  Self scheduling only works out is you are a favorite.  Unit managers are stick in their ways.  Management as a whole is disconnected with the reality of what happens in patient care.  No pay raise for getting BSN or any other degrees.  To get a raise for education, you must do the PACE program which requires a rediculous amount of extracurricular activities and isn't worth the time.  Many old prudes in management.

review_title: It is a pleasure and makes you to want to go back every day.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Terre Haute, IN
pros: The building is very nice
cons: Poor benefits. Little opportunity for upward mobility among healthcare professional staff unless you've been an employee >25 years. job_title: Housekeeper in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Starting wage $10 plus shift differentials, hires full-time pretty often, benefits start soon after full-time status, overtime often available. Nonprofit, so qualifies for public service student loan forgiveness. I would have stayed indefinitely if it payed better.
cons: Lifting, walking, pushing, repetitive movements. Always short-staffed, always want you to do more and do it faster. Communication between management and shifts could be better. Hires LGBTQ and POC, some tattoos and piercings fine.
